title: CSS Class List Validator
description: Validate a list of CSS classes. A valid list consists of one or more class names, separated by single spaces. Class names can contain letters, numbers, and hyphens, but cannot start with a number.
solutionSummary: This complex pattern validates a space-separated list of CSS classes. `[a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9\-]*` defines a valid class name (starts with a letter, followed by letters, numbers, or hyphens). The `(?!-)` is a negative lookahead to ensure class names don't end with a hyphen. The second part, `(\s[a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9\-]*(?!-))*`, is a group that matches subsequent classes, each preceded by a single space and also not ending in a hyphen. The outer `*` allows for zero or more additional classes.
